title: SaxaVord Spaceport to host HyImpulse orbital rocket launches
summary: The UK’s SaxaVord Spaceport plans host orbital launches of HyImpulse Technologies rockets from late 2025.

title: European launch deal praised despite competition questions
summary: European governments and launch companies hailed an agreement reached last week on the future of the continent’s launch industry despite questions about how one aspect of that agreement, a competition, will work.

title: HyImpulse Ditch SaxaVord in Favour of Australia for Maiden Flight
summary:
German launch startup HyImpulse Technologies has announced that it will launch the maiden flight of its suborbital SR75 launch vehicle from the Southern Launch Koonibba Test Range in Australia. The maiden flight of the SR75 vehicle had initially been slated to be launched from SaxaVord Spaceport in Scotland. In fact, HyImpulse had already received a […]
The post HyImpulse Ditch SaxaVord in Favour of Australia for Maiden Flight appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: House Passes CR To Keep Government Open Until Early 2024
summary: The House easily passed a new Continuing Resolution today to keep the government operating after Friday.  The situation unfolded just like the last shutdown crisis, with Democrats deciding to support […]

title: Telesat taps Aalyria to provide network orchestration
summary: Telesat selected Aalyria Technologies to orchestrate communications for its Lightspeed low-Earth orbit broadband network.
